shows.title: Pearl Harbor Revelations / Staying Young
shows.guests: T. Martin Bennett, Dr. Tony Youn
shows.first_half: Author T. Martin Bennett delved into the life of Mitsuo Fuchida, the Japanese pilot who led the attack on Pearl Harbor. Followed by Dr. Tony Youn on various facets of plastic surgery.

shows.title: Ghost Hunting & Movie Business / Open Lines
shows.guests: R.A. Mihailoff, Rick McCallum, Open Lines
shows.first_half: Stuntman Rick McCallum and actor R.A. Milhailoff (both members of the Hollywood Ghost Hunters) will discuss their careers in the movie making business. They'll bring us their unique perspective from being on the inside and reveal what it takes to do a stunt, portray a character, and make a good movie. They'll also delve into the many adventures they've had being members of the Hollywood Ghost Hunters. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give George a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!

shows.title: Shared Death Experiences / Overcoming Depression
shows.first_half: Psychotherapist William Peters joins Lisa Garr (email) to discuss the shared death experience (SDE), which occurs when someone dies and a caregiver or loved one reports that they participated in the dying person’s process. He believes the SDE is similar to the NDE and affirms the existence of a benevolent afterlife. Followed by podcast host Christian Rasmussen, who speaks about overcoming depression and anxiety, and the role of mushrooms in addiction recovery and mental health.
shows.second_half: 6-10pm PT: Art Bell - Somewhere in Time returns to 1/28/99 when Linda Moulton Howe shared UFO reports, and Open Lines featured a special 'Antichrist' Line.

shows.title: Neverending War / Noah’s Ark & Gobekli Tepe
shows.first_half: First Half: Joining George Noory, writer and documentary producer G. Edward Griffin contends that World War I did not end in 1918, and is still raging around us today. He suggests the end of military combat merely signaled the beginning of a slow, long-term transition from old-style war to new-style war and the development of a New World Order.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Explorer and author Aaron Judkins brings us his latest research into Noah’s Ark and Göbekli Tepe, and how these two ancient subjects intersect in surprising ways. He'll examine how early civilizations understood cataclysm, survival, and encounters with the divine.

shows.title: Life of Jim Morrison / Colors & Names
shows.first_half: First Half: Author and singer Paul Wyld presents his research on Jim Morrison, the lead singer of The Doors. He'll detail the specific books Morrison read and how their ideas influenced his craft. He'll also explore how Morrison's art made him both popular and brought him into conflict with authority, as well as his tragic last three months of life in Paris in 1971.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author B.P. Greycastle delves into how color affects our lives. He'll speak about color-coded names, how individual names impact our lives, and why color dictates many things we do on a daily basis.

shows.title: Bio-Electromagnetics & Zero Point / Deja Vu & Premonitions
shows.first_half: First Half: Physicist and engineer Thomas F. Valone will present his latest research in the fields of zero-point energy and bio-electromagnetic healing, with a focus on a recent NASA patent for a pulsed EMF device said to repair human tissue, as well as a high-voltage line modeled after Tesla’s discoveries.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Researcher and medium Dr. Ondre Seltzer discusses déjà vu, intuition, and premonitions, and why more people are having them. He'll also explain how we interact with subtle energies, timelines, and frequencies beyond ordinary perception, and how the mind may access information before we consciously register it.

shows.title: Secret Door Special
shows.first_half: Who's behind the Secret Door? Join George and four separate guests who change their voices as he tries to guess who they are… given only clues.

shows.title: Numerology for 2026 / Mental Techniques
shows.first_half: First Half: Numerologist Glynis McCants shares her numerological insights on what to expect in the new year 2026, and how to prepare for it. She'll delve into the significant shift about to take place, our Personal Year Cycles, and what's in store for some of the most influential world leaders.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Mentalist Jim Karol will discuss the power of the human mind and its infinite capabilities. He'll talk about his unique approach that combines cognitive fitness and mentalism, and demonstrate how anyone can enhance their mental strength, memory, and focus, using simple techniques.

shows.title: Alien Interactions / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Author of "The Plejaren Diaries," Zaysan "Z" Saldausky (William Saldausky), best known as "Z," joins guest host Connie Willis (info) to discuss his interactions and deepening relationship with a group of aliens. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give Connie a call and talk about whatever is on your mind!
